metadata.synopsis: The player sided with the drow and goblins and participated in the massacre of the grove. Gale is shocked by what happened and the fact that he participated in the slaughter. He wants to leave, so the player has to convince him to stay if indeed he wants Gale to stay. The mood and tone are dour and dark.

3.speaker: Gale
3.text: Go to sleep. If another knife awaits in the night, so be it.

17.speaker: Gale
17.text: Betrayed by a drow commander of the Absolute. How unexpected a turn of events.

10.speaker: Gale
10.text: How does it feel to kill a woman still flush with the warmth of your body? All par for the course for you, I suppose.

47.speaker: Gale
47.text: But no matter. What's one more kill but a fitting coda to a day of carnage?

26.speaker: Gale
26.text: This is the worst moment. When the screams of the dying have faded, and the conquering hordes howl and yelp as they come to their vile climax.

30.speaker: Gale
30.text: Massacre. A spectacle of slaughter. And I participated.

31.speaker: Gale
31.text: What are these bloody stumps that used to be such delicate harpists of the Weave?
31.context: CinematicNodeContext: He looks at his hands in Lady Macbeth fashion knowing that he participated in the destruction of the grove.NodeContext: He looks at his hands in Lady Macbeth fashion knowing that he participated in the destruction of the grove.

28.speaker: Player
28.text: They're the hands they always were. You've a knack for this.

12.speaker: Gale
12.text: Two shadows are darkening my soul. The shadow within and the shadow without:

22.speaker: Gale
22.text: You led me down this path.

7.speaker: Player
7.text: Yes. And I got you the Idol of Silvanus along the way.
7.context: InternalNodeContext: Gale consumed the idol after it was picked up after the Tiefling betrayal, but before this dialogue.

42.speaker: Gale
42.text: I don't know myself anymore. All this... It's not who I am. Around you, I'm not who I want to be.

8.speaker: Gale
8.text: Precious little love lost between us, isn't there?

16.speaker: Gale
16.context: NodeContext: The "and good riddance" is implied.

43.speaker: Player
43.text: Stay. We make each other stronger. We make each other survive.

34.speaker: Gale
34.text: Yes. Yes, I suppose we do. Few things are more powerful than the will to live.

50.speaker: Gale
50.text: But carnage such as this... The shadow within is spreading like poison, corrupting kindness and compassion.

0.speaker: Gale
0.text: Perhaps you'll understand me better when you know the truth of my condition.

14.speaker: Player
14.text: Go on then. There's no time like the present.

9.speaker: Gale
9.text: No - a night like this is unfit to bear witness to such a tale. It's unfit for most things. Now please - permit me some peace amidst this vile revelry. We'll speak, but another time.
9.context: NodeContext: Grim, deeply unhappy with everything that's happened (including having to endure a party of drunken goblins). Firmly but politely telling the player to go away.

36.speaker: Player
36.text: I guess I'll find out, when you're ready to tell me.

18.speaker: Gale
18.text: You will. But not until then. Now please - I'd prefer to be alone with my regrets. Enjoy these vile revelries, if that's your inclination. It certainly isn't mine.
18.context: NodeContext: Grim, deeply unhappy with everything that's happened (including having to endure a party of drunken goblins). Firmly but politely telling the player to go away.

6.speaker: Gale
6.text: I thought the orb to be the greatest of my sins, but I see now there are darker depths to which I might yet sink. You may be content to sink into that abyss, but I assure you - I am not.
6.context: NodeContext: Stern/grim - not impressed with the player's recent behaviour. Ending the conversation.

20.speaker: Gale
20.text: At what cost? Are our lives truly worth so many others?

2.speaker: Gale
2.text: I can see the answer in your eyes. And that's why I'm leaving.

25.speaker: Player
25.text: You don't stand a chance alone. You're free to go. I dare you.

37.speaker: Gale
37.text: Gods damn you - you're right. Few things are more powerful than the will to live.

13.speaker: Gale
13.text: What chances I have, I'll take them. I'd rather roll the dice than deliver all this death.

19.speaker: Player
19.text: Yes. And I got you the Idol of Silvanus along the way.
19.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player collected the Idol after betrating the Tieflings but hasn't given it to Gale yet.

24.speaker: Player
24.text: I'm sorry you feel that way.

35.speaker: Gale
35.text: It's time to stop making excuses.

15.speaker: Player
15.text: You make your own choices. Don't blame me for their outcomes.

27.speaker: Gale
27.text: Don't blame me for detesting them.

5.speaker: Player
5.text: Quit whining. You're killing the mood.

41.speaker: Gale
41.text: You really are absolutely heartless, aren't you?

48.speaker: Player
48.text: You've seen your own true nature. Accept it.

46.speaker: Player
46.text: Perhaps we've gone too far, but what's done is done.

38.speaker: Gale
38.text: I've said my piece. Now let me dull my tongue with wine.
